chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerry R. Fredrick Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gerry R. Fredrick Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gerry R. Fredrick Jr. was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Gerry R. Fredrick Jr. was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:02 AM - Defendant Gerry R. Fredrick in court with attorney Lindsay L. Erickson.  Defendant Gerry R. Fredrick in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf03 and 14cf60 (STC).    Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Bednar states Information will mirror criminal complaint.  Erickson/Defendant willint to proceed with Arraignment and enter not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

01:51 pm - Defendant Gerry R. Fredrick in court with attorney Lindsay L. Erickson.  Defendant Gerry R. Fredrick in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf03 (AIA) and 14cf60 (PTC).  Michlig states the plea proposal - State withdraws in light of new charges.  In 15cf03 - Erickson in receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Set for preliminary hearing.  Erickson/Michlig statement to modify bond to allow defendant to attend inpatient treatment at Koinonia if unable to post bond.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.

01:43 pm - Defendant Gerry R. Fredrick in court, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
